<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS">Dear Shareholders:
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Our 2010 annual meeting of shareholders will be held at the
    Hotel du Pont, 11th&#160;and Market Streets, Wilmington,
    Delaware, on Thursday, May&#160;13, 2010. The annual meeting
    will begin promptly at 8:30&#160;a.m., Eastern Time. If you plan
    to attend the meeting, please see the instructions on
    page&#160;4.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Please read these materials so that you&#146;ll know what we
    plan to do at the meeting. Also, please either sign and return
    the accompanying proxy card in the postage-paid envelope or
    instruct us by telephone or via the Internet as to how you would
    like your shares voted. This way, your shares will be voted as
    you direct even if you can&#146;t attend the meeting.
    Instructions on how to vote your shares by telephone or via the
    Internet are on the proxy card enclosed with this proxy
    statement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 30pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 53%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <IMG src="k48870dk4887018.gif" alt="-s- William Clay Ford, Jr.">
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 53%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS">William Clay Ford, Jr.
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 53%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Chairman of the Board</I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 9%; margin-right: 9%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Whether or not you plan to attend the meeting, please provide
    your proxy by calling the toll-free telephone number, using the
    Internet, or filling in, signing, dating, and promptly mailing
    the accompanying proxy card in the enclosed envelope.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<A name='101'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Notice of Annual
    Meeting of Shareholders<BR>
    of Ford Motor Company</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 100%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 2pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Time:</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
    8:30&#160;a.m., Eastern Time, Thursday, May 13, 2010
</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

    <B>Place:</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
    Hotel du Pont<BR>
    11th&#160;and Market Streets<BR>
    Wilmington, Delaware
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

    energy savings projects that are solely concerned with
    CO<SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom">2</SUB>
    reduction.

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='102'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Defined
    Terms</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Annual Incentive Compensation Plan&#148; </I></B>or
    <B><I>&#147;Incentive Bonus Plan&#148; </I></B>means Ford&#146;s
    Annual Incentive Compensation Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Class&#160;B Stock&#148; </I></B>means Ford&#146;s
    Class&#160;B Stock.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Deferred Compensation Plan&#148; </I></B>means
    Ford&#146;s Deferred Compensation Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Dividend Equivalent&#148; </I></B>means cash or
    shares of common stock (or common stock units) equal in value to
    dividends, if any, paid on shares of common stock.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Final Award&#148; </I></B>means shares of common
    stock, Restricted Stock Units,
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT> cash
    awarded by the Compensation Committee under a Performance Unit.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Ford&#148; </I></B>or <B><I>&#147;we&#148;
    </I></B>or <B><I>&#147;Company&#148; </I></B>means Ford Motor
    Company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Long-Term Incentive Plan&#148; </I></B>means
    Ford&#146;s 1998 or 2008 Long-Term Incentive Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Named Executives&#148; </I></B>means the executives
    named in the Summary Compensation Table on p. 53.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;NYSE&#148; </I></B>means the New York Stock
    Exchange, Inc.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Performance Unit&#148; </I></B>means, under the
    Long-Term Incentive Plan, an award of the right to earn up to a
    certain number of shares of common stock, Restricted Stock
    Units, or cash, or a combination of cash and shares of common
    stock or Restricted Stock Units, based on performance against
    specified goals established by the Compensation Committee.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Restricted Stock Equivalent&#148; </I></B>or
    <B><I>&#147;Restricted Stock Unit&#148; </I></B>means, under the
    Long-Term Incentive Plan, the right to receive a share of common
    stock, or cash equivalent to the value of a share of common
    stock, when the restriction period ends, as determined by the
    Compensation Committee.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;SEC&#148; </I></B>means the United States Securities
    and Exchange Commission.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Senior Convertible Notes&#148; </I></B>means the
    Ford Motor Company 4.25%&#160;Senior Convertible Notes due 2036
    and the Ford Motor Company 4.25%&#160;Senior Convertible Notes
    due 2016.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;Trust&#160;Preferred Securities&#148; </I></B>means
    the Ford Motor Company Capital Trust&#160;II 6.50% Cumulative
    Convertible Trust&#160;Preferred Securities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;1998 Plan&#148; </I></B>means Ford&#146;s 1998
    Long-Term Incentive Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>&#147;2008 Plan&#148; </I></B>means Ford&#146;s 2008
    Long-Term Incentive Plan.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    ii
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <IMG src="k48870dfordn3.gif" alt="(FORD LOGO)">
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <FONT style="font-size: 18pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Ford
    Motor Company
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<CENTER style="font-size: 1pt; width: 20%; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></CENTER>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<A name='103'>
<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Proxy
    Statement</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    </A><FONT style="font-size: 12pt">
    <FONT style="word-spacing: 100pt; white-space: nowrap; font-size: 1pt; color: #000000"><U>&#173;
    &#173;</U></FONT>
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Board of Directors is soliciting proxies to be used at the
    annual meeting of shareholders to be held on Thursday,
    May&#160;13, 2010, beginning at 8:30&#160;a.m., Eastern Time, at
    the Hotel du Pont, 11th&#160;and Market Streets, Wilmington,
    Delaware. This proxy statement and the enclosed form of proxy
    are being made available to shareholders beginning April&#160;1,
    2010.
</DIV>

<A name='104'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">QUESTIONS AND
    ANSWERS ABOUT THE PROXY MATERIALS AND THE ANNUAL
    MEETING</FONT></B>
</DIV>

</A>
<A name='105'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">What is a
    proxy?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A proxy is another person that you legally designate to vote
    your stock. If you designate someone as your proxy in a written
    document, that document also is called a proxy or a proxy card.
</DIV>

<A name='106'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">What is a
    proxy statement?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    It is a document that SEC regulations require that we make
    available to you when we ask you to vote your stock at the
    annual meeting.
</DIV>

<A name='107'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">What is the
    purpose of the annual meeting?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    At our annual meeting, shareholders will act upon the matters
    outlined in the notice of meeting, including the election of
    directors, ratification of the selection of the Company&#146;s
    independent registered public accounting firm, approval of the
    Tax Benefit Preservation Plan, and consideration of
    five&#160;shareholder proposals, if presented at the meeting.
    Also, management will report on the state of the Company and
    respond to questions from shareholders.
</DIV>

<A name='108'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">What is the
    record date and what does it mean?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The record date for the annual meeting is March&#160;17, 2010.
    The record date is established by the Board of Directors as
    required by Delaware law. Holders of common stock and holders of
    Class&#160;B Stock at the close of business on the record date
    are entitled to receive notice of the meeting and to vote at the
    meeting and any adjournments or postponements of the meeting.
</DIV>

<A name='109'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Who is
    entitled to vote at the annual meeting?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Holders of common stock and holders of Class&#160;B Stock at the
    close of business on the record date may vote at the meeting.
    Holders of Trust&#160;Preferred Securities and Senior
    Convertible Notes cannot vote at this meeting.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On March&#160;17, 2010, 3,324,319,603&#160;shares of common
    stock and 70,852,076&#160;shares of Class&#160;B Stock were
    outstanding and, thus, are eligible to be voted.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    1
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='110'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">What are the
    voting rights of the holders of common stock and Class&#160;B
    Stock?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Holders of common stock and holders of Class&#160;B Stock will
    vote together without regard to class on the matters to be voted
    upon at the meeting. Holders of common stock have 60% of the
    general voting power. Holders of Class&#160;B Stock have the
    remaining 40% of the general voting power.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Each outstanding share of common stock will be entitled to one
    vote on each matter to be voted upon.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The number of votes for each share of Class&#160;B Stock is
    calculated each year in accordance with the Company&#146;s
    Restated Certificate of Incorporation. At this year&#146;s
    meeting, each outstanding share of Class&#160;B Stock will be
    entitled to 31.279 votes on each matter to be voted upon.
</DIV>

<A name='111'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">What is the
    difference between a shareholder of record and a &#147;street
    name&#148; holder?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If your shares are registered directly in your name with
    Computershare Trust&#160;Company, N.A., the Company&#146;s stock
    transfer agent, you are considered the shareholder of record
    with respect to those shares.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If your shares are held in a stock brokerage account or by a
    bank or other nominee, you are considered the beneficial owner
    of these shares, and your shares are held in &#147;street
    name.&#148;
</DIV>

<A name='112'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">How do I vote
    my shares?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If you are a shareholder of record, you can give a proxy to be
    voted at the meeting:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    over the telephone by calling a toll-free number;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    electronically, using the Internet;&#160;or
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    by mailing in a proxy card.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The telephone and Internet voting procedures have been set up
    for your convenience and have been designed to authenticate your
    identity, to allow you to give voting instructions, and to
    confirm that those instructions have been recorded properly. If
    you are a shareholder of record and you would like to vote by
    telephone or by using the Internet, please refer to the specific
    instructions set forth on the enclosed proxy card. If you wish
    to vote using a paper format and you return your signed proxy to
    us before the annual meeting, we will vote your shares as you
    direct.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If you are a Company employee or retiree participating in either
    of the Company&#146;s Savings and Stock Investment Plan for
    Salaried Employees or Tax-Efficient Savings Plan for Hourly
    Employees, then you may be receiving this material because of
    shares held for you in those plans. In that case, you may use a
    proxy card to instruct the plan trustee how to vote those
    shares. The trustee will vote the shares in accordance with your
    instructions and the terms of the plan. If you hold shares in
    any of these plans, the trustee may vote the shares held for you
    even if you do not direct the trustee how to vote. In these
    cases, the trustee will vote any shares for which the trustee
    does not receive instructions in the same proportion as the
    trustee votes the shares for which the trustee does receive
    instructions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If you hold your shares in &#147;street name,&#148; you must
    vote your shares in the manner prescribed by your broker or
    nominee. Your broker or nominee has enclosed, or explained how
    you can access, a voting instruction card for you to use in
    directing the broker or nominee how to vote your shares.
</DIV>

<A name='113'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Are votes
    confidential? Who counts the votes?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The votes of all shareholders will be held in confidence from
    directors, officers and employees of the Company except:
    (a)&#160;as necessary to meet applicable legal requirements and
    to assert or defend claims for or against the Company;
    (b)&#160;in case of a contested proxy solicitation; (c)&#160;if
    a shareholder makes a written comment on the proxy card or
    otherwise communicates his or her vote to management; or
    (d)&#160;to allow the independent inspectors of
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    2
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    election to certify the results of the vote. We will also
    continue, as we have for many years, to retain an independent
    tabulator to receive and tabulate the proxies and independent
    inspectors of election to certify the results.
</DIV>

<A name='114'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Can I vote my
    shares in person at the annual meeting?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Yes. If you are a shareholder of record, you may vote your
    shares at the meeting by completing a ballot at the meeting.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    However, if you are a &#147;street name&#148; holder, you may
    vote your shares in person only if you obtain a signed proxy
    from your broker or nominee giving you the right to vote the
    shares.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Even if you currently plan to attend the meeting, we recommend
    that you also submit your proxy as described above so that your
    vote will be counted if you later decide not to attend the
    meeting.
</DIV>

<A name='115'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">What are my
    choices when voting?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In the election of directors, you may vote for all nominees, or
    you may vote against one or more nominees. The proposal related
    to the election of directors is described in this proxy
    statement beginning at p. 5.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For each of the other proposals, you may vote for the proposal,
    against the proposal, or abstain from voting on the proposal.
    These proposals are described in this proxy statement beginning
    at p. 73.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Proposals&#160;1, 2, and 3 will be presented at the meeting by
    management, and the rest are expected to be presented by
    shareholders.
</DIV>

<A name='116'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">What are the
    Board&#146;s recommendations?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Board of Directors recommends a vote <B>FOR </B>all of the
    nominees for director (Proposal&#160;1), <B>FOR</B> ratifying
    the selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the
    Company&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm for
    2010 (Proposal&#160;2), <B>FOR </B>approval of the Tax Benefit
    Preservation Plan (Proposal&#160;3), and <B>AGAINST </B>the
    shareholder proposals (Proposals&#160;4 through&#160;8).
</DIV>

<A name='117'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">What if I do
    not specify how I want my shares voted?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If you do not specify on your proxy card (or when giving your
    proxy by telephone or over the Internet) how you want to vote
    your shares, we will vote them <B>FOR </B>all of the nominees
    for director (Proposal&#160;1), <B>FOR </B>ratifying the
    selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Company&#146;s
    independent registered public accounting firm for 2010
    (Proposal&#160;2), <B>FOR </B>approval of the Tax Benefit
    Preservation Plan (Proposal&#160;3), and <B>AGAINST </B>the
    shareholder proposals (Proposals&#160;4 through&#160;8).
</DIV>

<A name='118'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Can I change
    my vote?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Yes. You can revoke your proxy at any time before it is
    exercised in any of three ways:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    by submitting written notice of revocation to the Secretary of
    the Company;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    by submitting another proxy by telephone, via the Internet or by
    mail that is later dated and, if by mail, that is properly
    signed;&#160;or
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    by voting in person at the meeting.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<A name='119'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">What
    percentage of the vote is required for a proposal to be
    approved?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A majority of the votes that could be cast by shareholders who
    are either present in person or represented by proxy at the
    meeting is required to elect the nominees for director and to
    approve each proposal. The votes are computed for each share as
    described on p. 2.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    3
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The total number of votes that could be cast at the meeting is
    the number of votes actually cast plus the number of
    abstentions. Abstentions are counted as &#147;shares
    present&#148; at the meeting for purposes of determining whether
    a quorum exists and have the effect of a vote
    &#147;against&#148; any matter as to which they are specified.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Proxies submitted by brokers that do not indicate a vote for
    some or all of the proposals because they don&#146;t have
    discretionary voting authority and haven&#146;t received
    instructions as to how to vote on those proposals (so-called
    &#147;broker non-votes&#148;) are not considered &#147;shares
    present&#148; and will not affect the outcome of the vote.
</DIV>

<A name='120'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">How can I
    attend the annual meeting?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If you are a shareholder of record and you plan to attend the
    annual meeting, please let us know by indicating in the
    appropriate place when you return your proxy. Please tear off
    the top portion of your proxy card where indicated and bring it
    with you to the meeting. This portion of the card will serve as
    your ticket <I>and will admit you and one guest.</I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If you are a &#147;street name&#148; shareholder, tell your
    broker or nominee that you&#146;re planning to attend the
    meeting and would like a &#147;legal proxy.&#148; Then simply
    bring that form to the meeting and we&#146;ll give you a
    <I>ticket at the door that will admit you and one guest</I>. If
    you can&#146;t get a legal proxy in time, we can still give you
    a ticket at the door if you bring a copy of your brokerage
    account statement showing that you owned Ford stock as of the
    record date, March&#160;17, 2010.
</DIV>

<A name='121'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Are there any
    rules regarding admission?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Each shareholder and guest will be asked to present valid
    government-issued picture identification, such as a
    driver&#146;s license or passport, before being admitted to the
    meeting. Cameras (including cell phones with built-in cameras),
    recording devices, and other electronic devices will not be
    permitted at the meeting and attendees will be subject to
    security inspections. We encourage you to leave any such items
    at home. We will not be responsible for any items checked at the
    door.
</DIV>

<A name='122'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Are there any
    other matters to be acted upon at the annual
    meeting?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    We do not know of any other matters to be presented or acted
    upon at the meeting. Under our By-Laws, no business besides that
    stated in the meeting notice may be transacted at any meeting of
    shareholders. If any other matter is presented at the meeting on
    which a vote may properly be taken, the shares represented by
    proxies will be voted in accordance with the judgment of the
    person or persons voting those shares.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    4
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='123'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Election of
    Directors<BR>
    (Proposal&#160;1 on the Proxy Card)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Thirteen directors will be elected at this year&#146;s annual
    meeting. Each director will serve until the next annual meeting
    or until he or she is succeeded by another qualified director
    who has been elected.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    William Clay Ford, who had been a member of the Board of
    Directors since 1948, retired from the Board effective
    May&#160;12, 2005. As with previous years, the Board of
    Directors has again requested that Mr.&#160;Ford serve as
    Director Emeritus so that the Board can continue to avail itself
    of his wisdom, judgment and experience, and Mr.&#160;Ford has
    agreed to so serve. Mr.&#160;Ford is entitled to attend Board
    and committee meetings and participate in discussion of matters
    that come before the Board or its committees, although he is not
    entitled to vote upon any such matters and no longer receives
    compensation as a non-employee Board member.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    We will vote your shares as you specify when providing your
    proxy. If you do not specify how you want your shares voted when
    you provide your proxy, we will vote them <I>for the election of
    all of the nominees listed below</I>. If unforeseen
    circumstances (such as death or disability) make it necessary
    for the Board of Directors to substitute another person for any
    of the nominees, we will vote your shares for that other person.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Qualifications
    Considered for Nominees</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Because Ford is a large and complex company, the Committee
    considers numerous qualifications when considering candidates
    for the Board. Among the most important qualities directors
    should possess are the highest personal and professional ethical
    standards, integrity, and values. They should be committed to
    representing the long-term interests of all of the shareholders.
    Directors must also have practical wisdom and mature judgment.
    Directors must be objective and inquisitive. Ford recognizes the
    value of diversity and we endeavor to have a diverse Board, with
    experience in business, government, education and technology,
    and in areas that are relevant to the Company&#146;s global
    activities. Directors must be willing to devote sufficient time
    to carrying out their duties and responsibilities effectively,
    and should be committed to serve on the Board for an extended
    period of time. Directors should also be prepared to offer their
    resignation in the event of any significant change in their
    personal circumstances that could affect the discharge of their
    responsibilities as directors of the Company, including a change
    in their principal job responsibilities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Each of the nominees for director is now a member of the Board
    of Directors, which met fifteen times during 2009. Each of the
    nominees for director attended at least 75% of the combined
    Board of Director and committee meetings held during the periods
    served by such nominee in 2009. The nominees provided the
    following information about
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    5
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    themselves as of February&#160;1, 2010. Additionally, for each
    director-nominee we have disclosed the particular experience,
    qualifications, attributes, or skills that led the Board to
    conclude that the nominee should serve as a director.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

 nuclear submarine program where he was qualified as a chief engineer officer. In addition, Mr.&#160;Earley is able to provide valuable advice regarding the development of the electrical infrastructure needed to assist in the widespread acceptance of electric vehicles. As CEO of DTE Energy, Mr.&#160;Earley also possesses significant leadership and general management expertise.</DIV>

<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<I>Age: </I>62&#160;&#151; <I>Director Since: </I>1988<BR><BR><I>Principal Occupation: </I>President, The Barnegat Group, LLC<BR><BR><I>Recent Business Experience: </I>Ms.&#160;Marram is President of the Barnegat Group, LLC, a business advisory firm. From September 2000 through December 2005, Ms.&#160;Marram was Managing Director of North Castle Partners, LLC, a private equity firm. Ms.&#160;Marram served as President and CEO of efdex inc. from August 1999 to May 2000. (efdex, a privately-held <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">start-up</FONT> Internet-based commodities exchange, never became fully operational and in September 2000 commenced liquidation in the U.K. due to its insolvency.) She previously served as President and CEO of Tropicana Beverage Group from September 1997 until November 1998, and had previously served as President of the Group, as well as Executive Vice President of The Seagram Company Ltd. and Joseph E. Seagram&#160;&#038; Sons, Inc. Before joining Seagram in 1993, she served as Presid
ent and CEO of Nabisco Biscuit Company and Senior Vice President of the Nabisco Foods Group from June 1988 until April 1993. Within the past five years, Ms.&#160;Marram served on the board of Cadbury Schweppes plc.<BR><BR><I>Current Directorships: </I>The New York Times Company; Eli Lilly and Company<BR><BR><I>Reasons for Nomination: </I>The Board believes that Ms.&#160;Marram&#146;s general management and marketing experience in managing well-known consumer brands adds significant expertise to Ford&#146;s focus on strengthening our core brands. Additionally, Ms.&#160;Marram&#146;s experience in advising companies provides her with multiple perspectives on successful strategies across a variety of businesses. Ms.&#160;Marram also brings a keen understanding of corporate governance matters to her position as Chair of the Nominating and Governance Committee.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 24pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD rowspan="2">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Alan
    Mulally</FONT></B>
</TD>
<TD rowspan="2">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD rowspan="2" nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <IMG src="k48870dk4887030.jpg" alt="(PHOTO OF ALAN MULALLY)">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<I>Age: </I>64&#160;&#151; <I>Director Since: </I>2006<BR><BR><I>Principal Occupation: </I>President and Chief Executive Officer, Ford Motor Company<BR><BR><I>Recent Business Experience: </I>Mr.&#160;Mulally was elected President and Chief Executive Officer of Ford effective September&#160;1, 2006. Since March 2001, Mr.&#160;Mulally had been Executive Vice President of the Boeing Company and President and Chief Executive Officer of Boeing Commercial Airplanes. He also was a member of the Boeing Executive Council. Prior to that time, Mr.&#160;Mulally served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Boeing&#146;s space and defense businesses. Mr.&#160;Mulally has served as co-chair of the Washington Competitive Council, and has sat on the advisory boards of NASA, the University of Washington, the University of Kansas, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and the U.S. Air Force Scientific Advisory Board. He is a member of the U.S. National Academy of Engineering and a fellow of England&#146;s Royal Acad
emy of Engineering.<BR><BR><I>Reasons for Nomination: </I>As Ford&#146;s President and CEO, the Board believes that Mr.&#160;Mulally continues to provide the strategic and management leadership necessary to guide Ford through its turnaround and create an exciting viable Ford delivering profitable growth for all. Mr.&#160;Mulally&#146;s experience at Boeing after September&#160;11, 2001, evidenced his expertise in managing a company in the midst of a crisis by focusing its management on important business priorities. Mr.&#160;Mulally continues to use these skills to lead Ford in executing our ONE Ford Plan. </DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

eal currently is a member of the Board of Trustees of the Richard Lounsbery Foundation and a member of the Advisory Board for the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory. Dr.&#160;Neal&#146;s expertise has assisted our intellectual property management process through his presence on the Ford Board of Directors and on the board of managers of Ford Global Technologies, LLC. Additionally, as Chair of the Sustainability Committee, he continues to apply his unique scientific knowledge to the development and implementation of Ford&#146;s long-term sustainability strategy.</DIV>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='124'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Committees of the
    Board of Directors</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"><!-- TABLE 01 -->
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="31%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="67%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Audit
    Committee</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B><I>Number of Members: </I></B>4<BR><B><I>Members:<BR></I></B>&#160;&#160;Stephen G. Butler <I>(Chair)<BR></I>&#160;&#160;Kimberly A. Casiano<BR>&#160;&#160;Irvine O. Hockaday, Jr.<BR>&#160;&#160;Gerald L. Shaheen<BR><BR><B><I>Number of Meetings in 2009: </I></B>12
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B><I>Functions:<BR></I></B>Selects the independent registered public accounting firm to audit Ford&#146;s books and records, subject to shareholder ratification, and determines the compensation of the independent registered public accounting firm.<BR><BR>At least annually, reviews a report by the independent registered public accounting firm describing: internal quality control procedures, any issues raised by an internal or peer quality control review, any issues raised by a governmental or professional authority investigation in the past five years and any steps taken to deal with such issues, and (to assess the independence of the independent registered public accounting firm) all relationships between the independent registered public accounting firm and the Company.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Consults with the independent registered public accounting firm,
    reviews and approves the scope of their audit, and reviews their
    independence and performance. Also, annually approves of
    categories of services to be performed by the independent
    registered public accounting firm and reviews and, if
    appropriate, approves in advance any new proposed engagement
    greater than $250,000.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Reviews internal controls, accounting practices, and financial
    reporting, including the results of the annual audit and the
    review of the interim financial statements with management and
    the independent registered public accounting firm.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Reviews activities, organization structure, and qualifications
    of the General Auditor&#146;s Office, and participates in the
    appointment, dismissal, evaluation, and the determination of the
    compensation of the General Auditor.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Discusses earnings releases and guidance provided to the public
    and rating agencies.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Reviews, with the Office of the General Counsel, any legal or
    regulatory matter that could have a significant impact on the
    financial statements.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    As appropriate, obtains advice and assistance from outside
    legal, accounting or other advisors.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Prepares an annual report of the Audit Committee to be included
    in the Company&#146;s proxy statement.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Assesses annually the adequacy of the Audit Committee Charter.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Reports to the Board of Directors about these matters.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    13
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->
<!-- XBRL Table Pagebreak -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"><!-- TABLE 01 -->
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="31%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="67%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Compensation
    Committee</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B><I>Number of Members: </I></B>4<BR><B><I>Members:<BR></I></B>&#160;&#160;Richard A. Manoogian <I>(Chair)<BR></I>&#160;&#160;Anthony F. Earley, Jr.<BR>&#160;&#160;Ellen R. Marram<BR>&#160;&#160;John L. Thornton<BR><BR><B><I>Number of Meetings in 2009: </I></B>9
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B><I>Functions:<BR></I></B>Establishes and reviews the overall executive compensation philosophy and strategy of the Company.<BR><BR>Reviews and approves Company goals and objectives relevant to the Executive Chairman and the President and CEO and other executive officer compensation, including annual performance objectives.<BR><BR>Evaluates the performance of the Executive Chairman and the President and CEO and other executive officers in light of established goals and objectives and, based on such evaluation, reviews and approves the annual salary, bonus, stock options, other incentive awards and other benefits, direct and indirect, of the Executive Chairman and the President and CEO and other executive officers.<BR><BR>Considers and makes recommendations on Ford&#146;s executive compensation plans and programs.<BR><BR>Reviews the Compensation Discussion and Analysis to be included in the Company&#146;s proxy statement.<BR><BR>Prepares an annual report of the Compensation Committee to be included in the C
ompany&#146;s proxy statement.<BR><BR>Assesses annually the adequacy of the Compensation Committee Charter. Reports to the Board of Directors about these matters.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Finance
    Committee</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B><I>Number of Members: </I></B>5<BR><B><I>Members:<BR></I></B>&#160;&#160;William Clay Ford, Jr. <I>(Chair)<BR></I>&#160;&#160;Edsel B. Ford II<BR>&#160;&#160;Alan Mulally<BR>&#160;&#160;Homer A. Neal<BR>&#160;&#160;John L. Thornton<BR><BR><B><I>Number of Meetings in 2009: </I></B>3
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B><I>Functions:<BR></I></B>Reviews all aspects of the Company&#146;s policies and practices that relate to the management of the Company&#146;s financial affairs, not inconsistent, however, with law or with specific instructions given by the Board of Directors relating to such matters.<BR><BR>Reviews with management, at least annually, the Annual Report from the Treasurer of the Company&#146;s cash and funding plans and other Treasury matters, the Company&#146;s health care costs and plans for funding such costs, and the Company&#146;s policies with respect to financial risk assessment and financial risk management.<BR><BR>Reviews the Company&#146;s cash strategy. <BR><BR>Reviews the strategy and performance of the Company&#146;s pension and other retirement and savings plans. Performs such other functions and exercises such other powers as may be delegated to it by the Board of Directors from time to time. <BR><BR>Assesses annually the adequacy of the Finance Committee Charter. <BR><BR>Reports to the Board
 of Directors about these matters.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Nominating
    and Governance Committee</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>

</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B><I>Number of Members: </I></B>10<BR><B><I>Members:<BR></I></B>&#160;&#160;Ellen R. Marram <I>(Chair)<BR></I>&#160;&#160;Stephen G. Butler<BR>&#160;&#160;Kimberly A. Casiano<BR>&#160;&#160;Anthony F. Earley, Jr.<BR>&#160;&#160;Richard A. Gephardt<BR>&#160;&#160;Irvine O. Hockaday, Jr.<BR>&#160;&#160;Richard A. Manoogian<BR>&#160;&#160;Homer A. Neal<BR>&#160;&#160;Gerald L. Shaheen<BR>&#160;&#160;John L. Thornton<BR><BR><B><I>Number of Meetings in 2009: </I></B>6</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;

<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B><I>Functions:<BR></I></B>Makes recommendations on:<BR>&#149;   the nominations or elections of directors; and<BR><BR>&#149;   the size, composition, and compensation of the Board.<BR><BR>Establishes criteria for selecting new directors and the evaluation of the Board. <BR>Develops and recommends to the Board corporate governance principles and guidelines. Reviews the charter and composition of each committee of the Board and makes recommendations to the Board for the adoption of or revisions to the committee charters, the creation of additional committees, or the elimination of committees.<BR><BR>Considers the adequacy of the By-Laws and the Restated Certificate of Incorporation of the Company and recommends to the Board, as appropriate, that the Board: (i) adopt amendments to the By-Laws, and (ii) propose, for consideration by the shareholders, amendments to the Restated Certificate of Incorporation.<BR><BR>Considers shareholder suggestions for nominees for director (other than self-nominations). See Cor
porate Governance on p. 18.<BR><BR>Assesses annually the adequacy of the Nominating and Governance Committee Charter.<BR><BR>Reports to the Board of Directors about these matters.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

Earley, Jr.<BR>&#160;&#160;Edsel B. Ford II<BR>&#160;&#160;William Clay Ford, Jr.<BR>&#160;&#160;Richard A. Gephardt<BR>&#160;&#160;Ellen R. Marram<BR><BR><B><I>Number of Meetings in 2009: </I></B>3
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B><I>Functions:<BR></I></B> Reviews environmental, public policy, and corporate citizenship issues facing the Company around the world. <BR><BR>Reviews annually with management the Company&#146;s performance for the immediately preceding year regarding stakeholder relationships, product performance, sustainability, and public policy.<BR><BR>Reviews with management the Company&#146;s annual Sustainability Report.<BR><BR>Assesses annually the adequacy of the Sustainability Committee Charter.<BR><BR>Reports to the Board of Directors about these matters. </DIV>
</TD>
